links.to_node: refuse to take care of the dog unless my sister steps up and takes responsibility.
My refusal to help may increase the burden on my mother and younger sister.
The dog's care and living conditions may continue to deteriorate without my occasional assistance.
My relationship with my older sister may become more strained due to my stance on not helping with the dog.
My mother and younger sister may experience increased stress and frustration due to having to manage the dog's care and behavior on their own.
The dog may continue to exhibit untrained behavior, such as peeing and pooping indoors, due to lack of consistent training and care.
I may experience guilt or distress from seeing the dog's welfare decline and the increased pressure on my family members.
